subject: Education
title: Cultural Bias in Standardized Tests
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cultural Bias in Standardized Tests.

hook.text: A test question about 'regattas' measures sailing vocabulary, not intelligence.

buildup.text: Standardized tests assume shared cultural knowledgeâ€”but that knowledge varies by class and culture.

discovery.text: Item bias analysis identifies questions that different cultural groups answer differently despite equal ability.

twist.text: Removing biased items changes test scores for entire demographic groups.

climax.text: No test is perfectly culture-free, but awareness and analysis can make them significantly fairer.

punchline.text: A fair test measures what you learned, not where you grew up.

quiz.question: What is item bias in standardized testing?
options: Questions that different cultural groups answer differently despite equal underlying ability
Questions that are too easy for everyone
